intro: Chelonopsis subglabra, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed chelonopsis, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, while its stems are smooth and often branching. The flowers are yellow and produce small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by the wind.
